meanings.definition: Minor crimes, especially committed by young people.
meanings.sent1: The police officer explained that the delinquencies in the neighborhood were mostly related to vandalism.
meanings.sent2: The judge specialized in cases involving delinquencies of teenagers.
meanings.sent3: The school principal found the delinquencies of the students quite concerning.
meanings.sent4: The rise in delinquencies among the youth was like a storm brewing in the community.
meanings.sent5: The newspaper headline screamed about the delinquencies plaguing the city streets.

meanings.definition: Failure to fulfill a duty or obligation.
meanings.sent1: Her delinquencies in completing her homework led to a drop in her grades.
meanings.sent2: The company faced financial losses due to delinquencies in meeting their deadlines.
meanings.sent3: His delinquencies in taking out the trash always caused arguments in the household.
meanings.sent4: The consequences of his delinquencies at work were severe, leading to his dismissal.
meanings.sent5: The delinquencies in following safety protocols resulted in a workplace accident.

meanings.definition: The state of being overdue in payment.
meanings.sent1: The delinquencies in rent payment led to the landlord issuing a warning.
meanings.sent2: The company faced financial difficulties due to delinquencies in settling their bills.
meanings.sent3: Her delinquencies in paying the electricity bill resulted in a temporary power cut.
meanings.sent4: The delinquencies in loan repayment caused a negative impact on his credit score.
meanings.sent5: The delinquencies in credit card payments accumulated hefty late fees.
